page.title: 16LYNN GLEN, DALRY
page.content: Lynn Glen, S.W. of the town, is part of the valley of Caaf Water. It has a long history, with ruins of old mills and houses, and folklore of witches and fairies. The Glen is a popular beauty spot. A band of limestone forms waterfalls and cataracts. Massive sandstone forms the cliff of Pinnioch Point, called Peden's Point, after the preacher who used it as a natural pulpit in Covenanter times. The woodland includes birch, hazel, rowan, beech and sycamore. In 1979, a representative of the Countryside Commission was invited to come and a grant-aided project was set up. Cars can now park beside a path leading through deciduous woodland to the waterfalls and picnic areas near Peden's Point. Steps, safety fences and seats make the area more attractive and accessible.
